speaker: CARPOOL MAN
line: Hurry up! Uh, next time, maybe take a leak before we leave work. Okay, Dipwads?

speaker: MAN WHO PEED 1
line: Can you read sign language, Guy?

speaker: CARPOOL MAN
line: Is that your IQ or the number of Dipwads your mother had?

speaker: CARPOOL MAN
line: Not you, too, Sandy? Sorry, man. You got to hold it till you get home.

speaker: CARPOOL MAN
line: See you tomorrow, Sandy.

speaker: CARPOOL MAN
line: Hey, Sandy, chop chop.

speaker: CARPOOL MAN
line: Help!

speaker: FADE TO
line: Mulder addressing the OPR committee in conference room. Several ADs are present.)

speaker: MULDER
line: Using a process that restores moisture to the documents and by a reassembling of fragments I should be able to recover a large percentage of the case material that was destroyed in my office fire several months ago... And while this process will be tedious and ongoing what I've already recovered will allow Agent Scully and I to begin work on the X-Files immediately.

speaker: AD MASLIN
line: Agent Mulder... Agent Mulder, I'm reading here a very pie-in-the-sky report about global domination plans by vicious, long-clawed spacelings? Is there going to be data to back this vague, omnibus account?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: AD #1
line: I see your renowned arrogance has been left quite intact. You're asking us to accept this report of a spaceship buried under polar ice and your death-defying escape from it?

speaker: MULDER
line: The ice had become superheated by the ship as it rose beneath us, causing the ice to collapse.

speaker: AD #1
line: This entire story is essentially unintelligible and, therefore, encourages unintelligible analysis.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I was hoping that you'd look more closely at the reports of mine and Agent Scully's medical conditions.

speaker: AD #2
line: These spacelings, Agent Mulder... They weren't something I saw in Men in Black?

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't see Men in Black.

speaker: AD #2
line: Well, it's a damn good movie.

speaker: MULDER
line: As much as this all may sound like science-fiction we can and will prove the validity of our report.

speaker: AD MASLIN
line: And, so, the plot... I-I'm just trying to get this straight. The plot is for these spacelings to take over the planet aided by a group of men here on earth?

speaker: MULDER
line: A shadow conspiracy within our own government.

speaker: AD MASLIN
line: Who are growing corn in the middle of the desert which features pollen which was genetically altered to hold a virus which will be taken away by bees whose sting transmits the virus, causing the growth of an extraterrestrial biological entity inside the human host?

speaker: MULDER
line: Which we will prove now that the X-Files have been reopened.

speaker: AD #1
line: Your presumption is far greater than the case you make for that eventuality.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not sure I understand.

speaker: AD #1
line: You're here to justify your reassignment on the X-Files with little more than a rattletrap account of high adventure in the Antarctic.

speaker: AD #2
line: Not to mention some very questionable travel expenses.

speaker: AD MASLIN
line: Let us remind you that the FBI is not a school for science or for the grinding of personal axes and, hopefully, you will be able to present us with some material evidence to support a continued investigation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Scully was assigned to the X-Files as a scientist, was stung by one of these bees and was infected with this virus. She is here today with hard and incontrovertible evidence... Scientific proof that the virus she was infected with is, in fact, extraterrestrial.

speaker: MULDER
line: Next time, I'll wear a clown suit and do balloon tricks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I was hoping it wouldn't come up.

speaker: MULDER
line: The only reason I was in there was because you assured me there was a scientific basis for what we saw.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, let me remind you once again... What I saw was very little.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, Scully, that excuse is not going to work this time. You were there and you were infected with that virus.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, yes there is a scientific basis for what happened to me. I was exposed to a virus but as it turns out, Mulder, that virus is not what you thought. Look, I can't identify it, Mulder-- I have run three separate tests--but I can tell you without a doubt that that virus' DNA and proteins are very much of this world.

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw what that virus did. I saw it generate a new being... An alien being inside a human body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It attacks and destroys human cells but that is all it does, Mulder. It creates nothing. Look, I don't like telling you this... And I know that you don't want to hear it... Not that you can't question me and what I saw but what you can't question is the science.

speaker: CSM
line: There was some sloppiness in Phoenix where they found the body. The local PD got involved. These were taken at the scene by a crime reporter.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: These were run in the press?

speaker: CSM
line: I trumped up a story about a crazy Indian on the loose. Never underestimate the public's willingness to blame the Red Man for... anything they can't explain.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: How did this happen?

speaker: CSM
line: He was one of ours. He must've accidentally injected himself while he was working on the virus. It took just 12 hours for the creature to gestate.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: This thing's alive?

speaker: CSM
line: Yes. It's killed a man.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: It's out there somewhere?

speaker: CSM
line: As far as I know.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: God almighty, we can't have this thing running loose.

speaker: CSM
line: I'm managing the situation.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: You can manage all you want. Someone's got to find this thing.

speaker: CSM
line: Someone has to kill it. The response must be equal to the threat.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: Can you dispose of this problem?

speaker: CSM
line: Yes.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're wasting your time.

speaker: MULDER
line: You need evidence to justify our reassignment. I've just got to bring it back from the ashes.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Nothing you might restore is going to help you, Agent Mulder. It's over and done. Your reassignment on the X-Files has been denied.

speaker: MULDER
line: How can it be denied? We're the only reason the X-Files were reopened in the first place. There's no other reason to reopen them.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm not arguing...

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then, who is?

speaker: SKINNER
line: When will you accept that no amount of pressure or reason will bring to heel a conspiracy whose members walk these halls with absolute impunity?

speaker: MULDER
line: Was there a vote?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Unanimous against.

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm no help to you outside the majority, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Inside or out, I don't see that there's a damn thing you can do for me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You can break their backs, Agent Mulder, with the proof about this virus. Proof that what you say it does is true.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't have that proof just yet.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Maybe I can give it to you. There's a file folder. It's on the desk in your old office.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Is that something for me? Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, if you're doing my filing.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Your filing?

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you doing in my office, Agent Spender?

speaker: SPENDER
line: I think there's been a miscommunication. I think someone failed to inform you.

speaker: MULDER
line: If you're about to tell me that you were sent down here to work on the X-Files I think the failure is simple judgment. I don't care what patronage got you this job. I put my life in here. I'm not going to let some brown-nose just slide in and take it all away from me.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I don't believe in your work, in the paranormal mumbo jumbo. So, don't presume I'm the one taking your place.

speaker: MULDER
line: No? Who is?

speaker: FOWLEY
line: Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: Diana, back on your feet. I guess that's the only way you could stab me in the back.

speaker: CSM
line: I need the patient bandaged and dressed. We'll be taking a trip.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: You want him what?

speaker: CSM
line: I'm sure I don't need to repeat myself. Please get the boy ready.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: But doing that now could kill him.

speaker: CSM
line: Let me put it to you simply: it's him or it's us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I just want to remind you that by not informing local PD we are in technical violation of state laws prohibiting contamination of a crime scene. Why do I bother?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, come here and take a look at this. Ever seen anything like this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are they?

speaker: MULDER
line: According to the investigator's notes in the file they're from an attack by a Native American man on a scientist.

speaker: SCULLY
line: With what kind of weapon?

speaker: MULDER
line: It says in the file he used his bare hands.

speaker: SCULLY
line: His bare hands? Mulder, this is hardwood.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh-huh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This kind of gouging didn't happen with anybody's bare hands. Not without the use of some kind of an implement. What is that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Aw. Somebody broke a nail.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it animal?

speaker: MULDER
line: It ain't RuPaul. The body of the other victim was found here on the sofa his viscera torn from his torso. But the MEs report says that the times of death were hours apart which means that this victim was dead hours before the second attack.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So the attacker never left.

speaker: MULDER
line: There wasn't an attack. I think it was celebrating its birthday. The first victim must have gotten infected with the virus somehow. Right here on the sofa was where the creature was born.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: That would account for the violence done to the man's torso. The virus producing an extraterrestrial biological entity that ripped away his chest as it birthed itself right here. Look.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, given the scenario that you just described, the rate of gestation would have been less than a day. It would have been about 12 hours, in fact. Okay, forgive the scientific argument just for a moment but you're saying this was done by something newborn?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's exactly what I'm saying.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, there isn't anything in the animal kingdom capable of this ferocity. ]

speaker: GIBSON
line: It was here... But it's gone now.

speaker: DRIVER THUG GUY
line: I should take a look.

speaker: GIBSON
line: It's not here. Why don't you believe me when you're so afraid of me?

speaker: CSM
line: I'm not afraid of you.

speaker: GIBSON
line: You think I can destroy you for what I know, because of what I am. You're thinking you could've destroyed me, too and if I don't find this creature, you will.

speaker: CSM
line: He'll find it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't see there's any argument here. You admit yourself that the crime report is a lie.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that doesn't mean that I can just accept your theory.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does it take? For this thing to come up and bite you on the ass? I saw these creatures. I saw them burst to life. You would've seen them, too but you were infected with that virus. You were passed out over my shoulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I know what you did. I know what happened to me but without ignoring the science, I can't... Listen, Mulder … You told me that my science kept you honest. That it made you question your assumptions. That by it, I'd made you a whole person. If I change now... It wouldn't be right... or honest.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm talking about extraterrestrial life alive on this planet in our lifetime. Forces that dwarf and precede all human history. I'm sorry, Scully, but this time your science is wrong.

speaker: ENGINEER #1
line: Wake up, Homer.

speaker: HOMER
line: I was awake. I was just thinking.

speaker: ENGINEER #1
line: Yeah, that would be a first. You're ten minutes late on your systems check.

speaker: HOMER
line: If there was a problem, we would have heard about it. Like Arizona's going to go without air conditioning for ten minutes.

speaker: ENGINEER #1
line: Hey, Homer, got something here in the bleed cooling system. See that? Five degrees off. Might be... Might be in the core reactor.

speaker: HOMER
line: No, no, no. It's got to be a monitoring glitch.

speaker: ENGINEER #1
line: Phone could start ringing any minute. You might want to check it out.

speaker: HOMER
line: All right.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Authorized officers and personnel only. This is a closed area.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened here?

speaker: SPENDER
line: You'll have to leave, Agent Mulder..

speaker: SCULLY
line: We received a call that a man was killed here.

speaker: SPENDER
line: A call from whom? Assistant Director Skinner?

speaker: MULDER
line: Let us through.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You're unauthorized to be here. You've ignored your superiors and come here without cause or permission. I'm going to get you censured for this and demand a review of AD Skinner's actions.

speaker: MULDER
line: Diana, let us in here.

speaker: FOWLEY
line: I can't. This facility has been sealed off by the NRC.

speaker: MULDER
line: A man was murdered.

speaker: FOWLEY
line: A workman was killed in an accident in a reactor where there was a systems failure.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then why are you here?

speaker: FOWLEY
line: We were called because of a possible connection to two previous deaths. From a case file that was stolen from our office.

speaker: MULDER
line: There is a connection.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let's get out of here, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I hope you know what you're doing, Diana. I hope you know whose errand you're running.

speaker: FOWLEY
line: I think I do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You weren't getting anywhere, Mulder. It was only making it worse.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's here, Scully, and they know it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do they know? Mulder, how do you know?

speaker: MULDER
line: Give me the keys and get in the car.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God. Gibson. Sorry, sweetie. Gibson? Gibson? Gibson, sweetheart? Oh, God.

speaker: GIBSON
line: Frankenstein? Really?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. No, you've been worked on by some good doctors. They did a fine job with your stitches.

speaker: GIBSON
line: You think they were butchers.

speaker: MULDER
line: They were butchers.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They should have changed your bandages, Gibson. You've got some swelling and some infection and you've got a fever. Why did they do this to you?

speaker: GIBSON
line: 'Cause I can read people's minds.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did you get in our car?

speaker: GIBSON
line: When they weren't looking, I snuck away. It's easy when you know what they're thinking.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why are you here?

speaker: GIBSON
line: They were using me 'cause I can communicate with it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Communicate with what?

speaker: GIBSON
line: You already know. You just don't want to believe it.

speaker: MULDER
line: The kid could find this thing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this kid belongs in a hospital.

speaker: MULDER
line: We could get his fever down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you can't just take him on some snipe hunt. He's in no condition. He belongs in a bed under constant medical care. Listen to me. What I'm saying is in your best interest, okay? We have to take every precaution. We have to make every effort to ensure that nothing happens to this boy because whatever he is, whatever gives him the ability to do what he does, he's your scientific evidence. It's just like we said. He could be the key to everything in the X-Files.

speaker: MULDER
line: We don't have the X-Files.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, but what if he could corroborate everything that you're saying? This boy could be our last, best chance.

speaker: FOWLEY
line: Agent Mulder. Fox, I'm going to get out of the car. I'm alone, all right?

speaker: MULDER
line: Diana, what are you doing here?

speaker: FOWLEY
line: I couldn't say anything to you earlier. I was given this assignment, Fox, okay? They offered it to me. I took the chance...

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm listening.

speaker: FOWLEY
line: ...to make sure someone served your interests. Someone who believes in the work. Hey, you and I found the X-Files together. Don't forget that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who sent you?

speaker: FOWLEY
line: I'm here on my own.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? To convince me of your noble intentions?

speaker: FOWLEY
line: Listen to me. That thing is somewhere inside the Number Four reactor building. Now, we can let them find it and destroy it or go find it ourselves. You need proof, Fox. You're so close. Why can't you see that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what's going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: You take Gibson.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: To find this thing.

speaker: FOWLEY
line: Agent Spender and I got a call. We were on a plane within an hour in constant contact.

speaker: MULDER
line: With who?

speaker: FOWLEY
line: The nuclear regulatory people. NRC was first on the scene. They found the victim but by the time we got there it had been removed. We never saw the body.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who removed it?

speaker: FOWLEY
line: I don't know. Couldn't get a straight answer. Then the NRC sealed off the Number Four reactor due to a problem with the heat transfer systems. I believe that was legitimate.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe that's why it's there. It wants heat. It needs heat. This thing gestated abnormally fast. What if heat activates it? It could spur on the virus and the rapid development of the entity. But it's still seeking heat. Why?

speaker: FOWLEY
line: What if it's still developing? You're not under the impression what we're looking for makes sense in any conventional way?

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're going to be fine, Gibson. You're going to be okay.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: Let's get a bed ready.

speaker: GIBSON
line: You're going to run more tests.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're going to get you well.

speaker: GIBSON
line: You say that, but you're going to run more tests just like the other doctors.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We have to run some more tests, Gibson.

speaker: GIBSON
line: You want to make me well but you're just thinking about yourself and what you can learn from me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're a very special boy, Gibson. You know that yourself.

speaker: GIBSON
line: I'm a very special lab rat.

speaker: FOWLEY
line: According to what little we could gather the victim's body was found near here.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's hot in here.

speaker: FOWLEY
line: We're right above the core reactor. This is part of the heat transfer cooling system.

speaker: FOWLEY
line: Looks organic.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe somebody's got the flu.

speaker: FOWLEY
line: What? What is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's something in there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I found something. I found something you're not going to believe.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ditto.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We did blood tests on Gibson and, Mulder, there's evidence of the virus in his system.

speaker: MULDER
line: The same virus you were exposed to?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm almost positive.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does that mean, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know … I don't know, but I think we're on to something. We're on to something huge-- a link.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll call that bet and raise you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Never mind. Just take care of Gibson.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There was a little boy in that room and he's gone. Does anybody know what happened to that little boy? His name is Gibson Praise. He was just in that room. Does anybody know what the hell is going on?!

speaker: PHOENIX DOCTOR
line: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Let's just calm down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That little boy that I brought in is missing.

speaker: PHOENIX DOCTOR
line: He can't be missing. He should still be in his bed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's not here!

speaker: GIBSON
line: It's here.

speaker: DRIVER THUG
line: Where?

speaker: GIBSON
line: Somewhere.

speaker: MULDER
line: Open the door, you son of a bitch! Open the door! Open it! Open it! Open the door, you...

speaker: FOWLEY
line: Fox! I'm going to go see if there's some other way in.

speaker: MULDER
line: Open it! Open the door!

speaker: GIBSON
line: I told you it was here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Gibson! Gibson! Gibson!

speaker: GUARD
line: There he is!

speaker: MULDER
line: Gibson! Gibson! Gibson! Gibson!

speaker: AD MASLIN
line: As I said and as I am forced to reiterate, Agent Mulder, the FBI is not here for vendettas or for the grinding of personal axes. Now, this holds not just for you but for everyone at the Bureau. You force us to put a point on this. To make some hard changes. You and Agent Scully will cease all material association with the X-Files. Refusal to do so will end in immediate dismissal. A probationary period will be set. You will now report to Assistant Director Kersh.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You're not supposed to come here. It's what was agreed to. It's the deal you made.

speaker: CSM
line: I had to congratulate you. Commend how you handled things. How you handled Mulder.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I did what I was asked.

speaker: CSM
line: You did well, son. He's on very thin ice now, you know?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Mulder will be back. As long as he lives, he won't give up.

speaker: CSM
line: Well, there's solutions, of course. Simple but extreme solutions. I've used these methods. They have their place. But not here.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You've killed men?

speaker: CSM
line: You can kill a man but you can't kill what he stands for... Not unless you first break his spirit. That's a beautiful thing to see.

speaker: MULDER
line: It would help if you'd shut the door. It would make it harder for them to see that I'm totally disregarding everything I was told.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Everything WE were told, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: They can't take away the X-Files, Scully. They tried.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, Agent Fowley's report to OPR painted the facts in an interesting way. I hope you haven't been betrayed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Fowley's report was a means to an end. Trying to protect the work. Protect the X-Files.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, Agent Fowley's report states that the man you saw attacked was bludgeoned by an unknown subject. She makes no mention of a little boy who as it happens, is nowhere to be found. It would seem that her report protects everything but you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Fowley took me to that plant at great risk to herself where I saw something that you refuse to believe in. Saw it again, Scully. And though it may not say it in her report, Diana saw it, too. And no matter what you think she's certainly not going to go around saying that just because science can't prove it isn't true.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't doubt what you saw, Mulder. I don't doubt you. I'm willing to believe, but not in a lie and not in the opposite of what I can prove. It comes down to a matter of trust. I guess it always has.

speaker: MULDER
line: You asking me to make a choice?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm asking you to trust my judgment. To trust me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't accept that. Not if it refutes what I know to be true.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, these are test results. DNA from the claw nail we found matching exactly the DNA from the virus you believe is extraterrestrial.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's the connection.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which matches exactly DNA that was found in Gibson Praise.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait a minute. I don't understand. You're saying that Gibson Praise is infected with the virus?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. It's a part of his DNA. In fact, it's a part of all of our DNA. It's called a genetic remnant. It's inactive junk DNA. Except in Gibson it's turned on.

speaker: MULDER
line: So if that were true, that would mean that Gibson is in some part extraterrestrial.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It would mean that all of us are.
